question.q: What is the average length of your showers in minutes? (Out of 60)
question.rec: Try to take the shorter showers for saving water. Donâ€™t leave the water running unnecessarily; it can use up to 5 gallon per minute!

question.q: Do you have an efficient showerhead?
question.rec: Inefficient showerheads can use up to 5 gallons per minute!

question.q: On a scale of 1-10, with 10 being the most often, how often do you wash dishes using a dish-washing machine as opposed to by hand?
question.rec: According to a study at the University of Bonn in Germany, dishwashers use half of energy, one-six of the water, and less soap than handwashing. Try to use the machine for big/medium loads!

question.q: When using a washing machine, do you use a front-loader (yes) or top-loader(no) ?
question.rec: Keep an eye out for front-loading machines; they use 40-75% less water than top-loaders!

question.q: Do you own a dishwashing machine?
Do you leave the water running when you wash dishes?
Do you recycle?
How do you get rid of the majority of paper products you no longer use/need? (throw out everything.....recycle everything)
question.rec: Try to recycle any paper products not needed, or reuse those that you can.

question.q: What material utensils (Silverware) do you use most often? (plastic = no, silverware = yes)
question.rec: Try to use metal utensils as much as possible and/or try to reuse plastic utensils as many times as you can to eliminate plastic waste.

question.q: How often do you purchase bottled drinks?
question.rec: Try to invest in a personal water bottle to eliminate plastic waste or reuse plastic waterbottles as much as possible.

question.q: How often do you leave lights or electronics on overnight?
question.rec: Turning off lights when not in use will lower your electric bills.

question.q: How often do you leave lights on when not in use/not in the room?
question.rec: Remembering to turn off unused lights throughout the day will significantly lower electric costs overtime.

question.q: Do you leave chargers connected when not in use or overnight?
question.rec: Chargers when not in use still use energy, unplug phone, laptop, any other chargers when not in use to reduce electricity use.

question.q: If you own an AC unit, what year was the unit made? If you do not, slide the bar all the way to the right (1915 - 2015)
question.rec: Older AC units tend to be far less energy efficient and investing in a newer model results in both energy and monetary savings over the life of the unit.

question.q: If you own an AC unit, how often do you use it? If you do not, slide the bar all the way to the left.
question.rec: Either reducing the time you keep the AC on or leaving it in a energy savings mode if available, will both reduce electricity costs and increase the life of the AC unit.

question.q: Do you use towels for CLEANING around the house/dorm/apartment?
question.rec: Investing in reuseable wipes/rags will reduce your paper waste and save money over time.

question.q: How well do you think you know what is recyclable and what is not?
question.rec: Educating yourself on what kind of recycling systems you are a part of will allow you to reduce how much waste you produce dramatically.

question.q: Do you own CFL or LED lights?
question.rec: Switching to these types of lightbulbs (CFL or LED) will ONLY save you money because they use less electricity, and last longer.

question.q: Approximately how hot do you keep your living space? (50-90 degrees F)
question.rec: The energy costs both financially and environmentally of heating are not linear, so if you can brave it, turn down your heater as much as you can, especially during the winter.

question.q: How far is your daily commute in miles? (0-100)
question.rec: Driving is a significant contributor of CO2 in our atmosphere

question.q: Do you carpool, or take public transit to work?
question.rec: Carpooling along with public transit are both great ways to save money and help the environment.
